channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Solving Royal Game of Ur Using Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Reinforcement Learning has recently surfaced as a very powerful tool to solve complex problems in the domain of board games, wherein an agent is generally required to learn complex strategies and moves based on its own experiences and rewards received.

item.title: Faint Features Tell: Automatic Vertebrae Fracture Screening Assisted by Contrastive Learning
item.description: Our method has a specificity of 99\% and a sensitivity of 85\% in binary classification, and a macio-F1 of 77\% in multi-classification, indicating that contrastive learning significantly improves the accuracy of vertebrae fracture screening, especially for the mild fractures and normal controls.

item.title: Hierarchically Decomposed Graph Convolutional Networks for Skeleton-Based Action Recognition
item.description: Graph convolutional networks (GCNs) are the most commonly used method for skeleton-based action recognition and have achieved remarkable performance.

item.title: Multi-Modal Representation Learning with SAT for Commodity Verification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a method to identify identical commodities.

item.title: A Constrained Deformable Convolutional Network for Efficient Single Image Dynamic Scene Blind Deblurring with Spatially-Variant Motion Blur Kernels Estimation
item.description: Most existing deep-learning-based single image dynamic scene blind deblurring (SIDSBD) methods usually design deep networks to directly remove the spatially-variant motion blurs from one inputted motion blurred image, without blur kernels estimation.

item.title: Efficient Self-Supervision using Patch-based Contrastive Learning for Histopathology Image Segmentation
item.description: Contrastive self-supervised learning provides a framework to learn meaningful representations using learned notions of similarity measures from simple pretext tasks.

item.title: Neural PCA for Flow-Based Representation Learning
item.description: Without exploiting any label information, the principal components recovered store the most informative elements in their \emph{leading} dimensions and leave the negligible in the \emph{trailing} ones, allowing for clear performance improvements of $5\%$-$10\%$ in downstream tasks.

item.title: Unsupervised Question Answering via Answer Diversifying
item.description: Previous works usually make use of heuristic rules as well as pre-trained models to construct data and train QA models.

item.title: A flexible empirical Bayes approach to multiple linear regression and connections with penalized regression
item.description: We introduce a new empirical Bayes approach for large-scale multiple linear regression.

item.title: Ultra-high-resolution unpaired stain transformation via Kernelized Instance Normalization
item.description: Hence, we proposed a strategy for ultra-high-resolution unpaired image-to-image translation: Kernelized Instance Normalization (KIN), which preserves local information and successfully achieves seamless stain transformation with constant GPU memory usage.

item.title: CAPER: Coarsen, Align, Project, Refine - A General Multilevel Framework for Network Alignment
item.description: Network alignment, or the task of finding corresponding nodes in different networks, is an important problem formulation in many application domains.

item.title: Retinal Structure Detection in OCTA Image via Voting-based Multi-task Learning
item.description: Automated detection of retinal structures, such as retinal vessels (RV), the foveal avascular zone (FAZ), and retinal vascular junctions (RVJ), are of great importance for understanding diseases of the eye and clinical decision-making.

item.title: Learning an Efficient Multimodal Depth Completion Model
item.description: With the wide application of sparse ToF sensors in mobile devices, RGB image-guided sparse depth completion has attracted extensive attention recently, but still faces some problems.

item.title: Joint Privacy Enhancement and Quantization in Federated Learning
item.description: The distributed operation of FL gives rise to challenges that are not encountered in centralized machine learning, including the need to preserve the privacy of the local datasets, and the communication load due to the repeated exchange of updated models.

item.title: CM-MLP: Cascade Multi-scale MLP with Axial Context Relation Encoder for Edge Segmentation of Medical Image
item.description: However, those methods have the following challenges when dealing with the edges of the medical images: (1) Previous convolutional-based methods do not focus on the boundary relationship between foreground and background around the segmentation edge, which leads to the degradation of segmentation performance when the edge changes complexly.

item.title: Integrative conformal p-values for powerful out-of-distribution testing with labeled outliers
item.description: This paper develops novel conformal methods to test whether a new observation was sampled from the same distribution as a reference set.

item.title: AniWho : A Quick and Accurate Way to Classify Anime Character Faces in Images
item.description: This paper aims to dive more deeply into various models available, including; InceptionV3, InceptionResNetV2, MobileNetV2, and EfficientNetB7 using transfer learning, to classify Japanese animation-style character faces.

item.title: ULISSE: A Tool for One-shot Sky Exploration and its Application to Active Galactic Nuclei Detection
item.description: In this work, we focus on applying our method to the detection of AGN candidates in a Sloan Digital Sky Survey galaxy sample, since the identification and classification of Active Galactic Nuclei (AGN) in the optical band still remains a challenging task in extragalactic astronomy.

item.title: DeepInteraction: 3D Object Detection via Modality Interaction
item.description: Existing top-performance 3D object detectors typically rely on the multi-modal fusion strategy.

item.title: Distance-Aware Occlusion Detection with Focused Attention
item.description: In this work, (1) we propose a novel three-decoder architecture as the infrastructure for focused attention; 2) we use the generalized intersection box prediction task to effectively guide our model to focus on occlusion-specific regions; 3) our model achieves a new state-of-the-art performance on distance-aware relationship detection.

item.title: Prompting as Probing: Using Language Models for Knowledge Base Construction
item.description: ProP implements a multi-step approach that combines a variety of prompting techniques to achieve this.

item.title: Consistency Regularization for Domain Adaptation
item.description: Collection of real world annotations for training semantic segmentation models is an expensive process.

item.title: SurvSHAP(t): Time-dependent explanations of machine learning survival models
item.description: Experiments on synthetic and medical data confirm that SurvSHAP(t) can detect variables with a time-dependent effect, and its aggregation is a better determinant of the importance of variables for a prediction than SurvLIME.

item.title: CitySim: A Drone-Based Vehicle Trajectory Dataset for Safety Oriented Research and Digital Twins
item.description: The development of safety-oriented research ideas and applications requires fine-grained vehicle trajectory data that not only has high accuracy but also captures a substantial number of critical safety events.

item.title: Enhancing User Behavior Sequence Modeling by Generative Tasks for Session Search
item.description: To help the encoding of the current user behavior sequence, we propose to use a decoder and the information of future sequences and a supplemental query.

item.title: Multimodal Across Domains Gaze Target Detection
item.description: This paper addresses the gaze target detection problem in single images captured from the third-person perspective.

item.title: Hierarchical Perceptual Noise Injection for Social Media Fingerprint Privacy Protection
item.description: The threat of fingerprint leakage from social media raises a strong desire for anonymizing shared images while maintaining image qualities, since fingerprints act as a lifelong individual biometric password.

item.title: IMPaSh: A Novel Domain-shift Resistant Representation for Colorectal Cancer Tissue Classification
item.description: The appearance of histopathology images depends on tissue type, staining and digitization procedure.

item.title: Adversarial Feature Augmentation for Cross-domain Few-shot Classification
item.description: Existing methods based on meta-learning predict novel-class labels for (target domain) testing tasks via meta knowledge learned from (source domain) training tasks of base classes.

item.title: Improving Computed Tomography (CT) Reconstruction via 3D Shape Induction
item.description: Chest computed tomography (CT) imaging adds valuable insight in the diagnosis and management of pulmonary infectious diseases, like tuberculosis (TB).

item.title: pystacked: Stacking generalization and machine learning in Stata
item.description: pystacked implements stacked generalization (Wolpert, 1992) for regression and binary classification via Python's scikit-lear}.

item.title: Unsupervised Anomaly Localization with Structural Feature-Autoencoders
item.description: Most commonly, the anomaly detection model generates a "normal" version of an input image, and the pixel-wise $l^p$-difference of the two is used to localize anomalies.

item.title: Structure Regularized Attentive Network for Automatic Femoral Head Necrosis Diagnosis and Localization
item.description: However, due to the tissue overlap, X-ray images are difficult to provide fine-grained features for early diagnosis.

item.title: Survival Mixture Density Networks
item.description: Survival MDN applies an invertible positive function to the output of Mixture Density Networks (MDNs).

item.title: VILT: Video Instructions Linking for Complex Tasks
item.description: This work addresses challenges in developing conversational assistants that support rich multimodal video interactions to accomplish real-world tasks interactively.

item.title: Learning Visibility for Robust Dense Human Body Estimation
item.description: An alternative approach is to estimate dense vertices of a predefined template body in the image space.

item.title: RIBAC: Towards Robust and Imperceptible Backdoor Attack against Compact DNN
item.description: Recently backdoor attack has become an emerging threat to the security of deep neural network (DNN) models.

item.title: DP-Rewrite: Towards Reproducibility and Transparency in Differentially Private Text Rewriting
item.description: Text rewriting with differential privacy (DP) provides concrete theoretical guarantees for protecting the privacy of individuals in textual documents.

item.title: Locate Then Ask: Interpretable Stepwise Reasoning for Multi-hop Question Answering
item.description: In this paper, we propose an interpretable stepwise reasoning framework to incorporate both single-hop supporting sentence identification and single-hop question generation at each intermediate step, and utilize the inference of the current hop for the next until reasoning out the final result.

item.title: Improving Knowledge-aware Recommendation with Multi-level Interactive Contrastive Learning
item.description: Specifically, we first construct local and non-local graphs for user/item in KG, exploring more KG facts for KGR.

item.title: A Novel Multi-Task Learning Approach for Context-Sensitive Compound Type Identification in Sanskrit
item.description: The phenomenon of compounding is ubiquitous in Sanskrit.

item.title: Recent Advances in Text-to-SQL: A Survey of What We Have and What We Expect
item.description: Text-to-SQL has attracted attention from both the natural language processing and database communities because of its ability to convert the semantics in natural language into SQL queries and its practical application in building natural language interfaces to database systems.

item.title: Individual Tree Detection in Large-Scale Urban Environments using High-Resolution Multispectral Imagery
item.description: We introduce a novel deep learning method for detection of individual trees in urban environments using high-resolution multispectral aerial imagery.

item.title: Rethinking Knowledge Distillation via Cross-Entropy
item.description: Furthermore, we smooth students' target output to treat it as the soft target for training without teachers and propose a teacher-free new KD loss (tf-NKD).

item.title: Deep 3D Vessel Segmentation based on Cross Transformer Network
item.description: In CTN, a transformer module is constructed in parallel to a U-Net to learn long-distance dependencies between different anatomical regions; and these dependencies are communicated to the U-Net at multiple stages to endow it with global awareness.

item.title: FairDisCo: Fairer AI in Dermatology via Disentanglement Contrastive Learning
item.description: Deep learning models have achieved great success in automating skin lesion diagnosis.

item.title: Exploiting Temporal Structures of Cyclostationary Signals for Data-Driven Single-Channel Source Separation
item.description: We study the problem of single-channel source separation (SCSS), and focus on cyclostationary signals, which are particularly suitable in a variety of application domains.

item.title: Repurposing Knowledge Graph Embeddings for Triple Representation via Weak Supervision
item.description: The majority of knowledge graph embedding techniques treat entities and predicates as separate embedding matrices, using aggregation functions to build a representation of the input triple.

item.title: LTE4G: Long-Tail Experts for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: After having trained an expert for each balanced subset, we adopt knowledge distillation to obtain two class-wise students, i. e., Head class student and Tail class student, each of which is responsible for classifying nodes in the head classes and tail classes, respectively.

item.title: Patient-level Microsatellite Stability Assessment from Whole Slide Images By Combining Momentum Contrast Learning and Group Patch Embeddings
item.description: However, the high resolution of WSI practically prevent direct classification of the entire WSI.
